text: 854171770 | MHS | 89506208 | | 509749 | 2/23/2001 12:00:00 AM | dvt , pseudogout | | DIS | Admission Date: 10/19/2001 Report Status: Discharge Date: 6/17/2001 ****** DISCHARGE ORDERS ****** CROGAN , TYRON 679-70-91-5 Eshing Tuc Ny Service: MED DISCHARGE PATIENT ON: 10/10/01 AT 10:00 AM CONTINGENT UPON Not Applicable WILL D/C ORDER BE USED AS THE D/C SUMMARY: YES Attending: MAYETTE , EUSEBIO IGNACIO , M.D. DISPOSITION: Rehabilitation DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS: TYLENOL ( ACETAMINOPHEN ) 650 MG PO Q4H PRN headache , joint pain ALLOPURINOL 100 MG PO QD ATENOLOL 50 MG PO BID HOLD IF: sbp<90 , hr<60 Food/Drug Interaction Instruction Take consistently with meals or on empty stomach. COLACE ( DOCUSATE SODIUM ) 100 MG PO BID HEPARIN 5 , 000 U SC BID NPH INSULIN HUMAN ( INSULIN NPH HUMAN ) 15 U SC QAM REG INSULIN HUMAN ( INSULIN REGULAR HUMAN ) Sliding Scale SC BID Call HO If BS > 400 For BS < 200 give 0 Units reg SC For BS from 201 to 250 give 0 Units reg SC For BS from 251 to 300 give 0 Units reg SC For BS from 301 to 350 give 8 Units reg SC For BS from 351 to 400 give 10 Units reg SC HOLD IF: fs<300 Instructions: please check fs bid OMEPRAZOLE 40 MG PO BID PREDNISONE Taper PO Give 15 mg QD X 1 day( s ) ( 5/17/01 -01 ) , then ---done Give 10 mg QD X 1 day( s ) ( 4/29/01 -01 ) , then ---done Give 5 mg QD X 1 day( s ) ( 9/4/01 -01 ) , then ---done GLUCOTROL XL ( GLIPIZIDE XL ) 10 MG PO QD Starting Today ( 6/11 ) HOLD IF: npo DIET: House / ADA 2100 cals/dy RETURN TO WORK: Not Applicable ALLERGY: Penicillins , Aspirin , Nsaid's ADMIT DIAGNOSIS: pseudogout , dvt PRINCIPAL DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS ;Responsible After Study for Causing Admission ) dvt , pseudogout OTHER DIAGNOSIS;Conditions , Infections , Complications , affecting Treatment/Stay ugib ( duod ulcer second to nsaid's ) non-sustained v-tah gout and hyperuricemia htn , ?cad s/p chole arthritis periph neuropathy OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES: OTHER TREATMENTS/PROCEDURES ( NOT IN O.R. ) BRIEF RESUME OF HOSPITAL COURSE: 84 yo M w/ hx iddm , htn , gout , recent ugib secondary to duod. ulcer now p/w R DVT and polyarticuar arthritis. On 10/25 pt presented to CBMC w/ UGIB secondary to duod. ulcer secondary to vioxx use , ulcer was cauterized. During his hospitalization his allopurinol was d/c.He also had incr R knee and elbow pain and swelling. He was d/c to rehab fascilitiy where his bs were difficutl to control. He was admitted to the WGH for further management. Leni's revleaed R peroneal DVT. His knee was tapped for straw colored fluid c/w pseudo-gout. WBC=17. Pseudo-gout: . Rx w/ prednisone taper and therapeutic tap of knee jo int. He has minimal pain now , is able to weight bear on R knee. DVT: will manage conservatively secondary to recent UGIB. Follow-up LE u/s on 9/27 and 6/26 have shown no extension of the DVT. Treat prophylactically w/ heparin sc , pneumoboot to lle. DM: Mr. Jayson Verville has had elevated blood sugars while on the prednisone taper. He was initially managed w/ nph and czi ss but his prior oral agent of Glucotrol XL was re-started and supplemented w/ am nph. His glucophage is being held secondary to renal insufficency ( creatnine=1.3 ). Urinary sx's- Ua wnl , uculture is pending. ADDITIONAL COMMENTS: Pt's DVT is being managed w/out anti-coagulation secondary to recent UGIB. Serial u/s have shown no extension of DVT. If pt. ambulating w/o ut incr LE symptoms will not need additional LE u/s. Pt's insulin regimen will need to be adjusted at rehab as he was on prednisone here which affected his sugars. DISCHARGE CONDITION: Stable TO DO/PLAN: No dictated summary ENTERED BY: VANDYNE , MARVIN MIGUEL , M.D. ( MX62 ) 10/10/01 @ 08 ****** END OF DISCHARGE ORDERS ******
